sections.content: Different models generate different solutions for the same problem. Systematic comparison reveals strengths, weaknesses, and hallucinations.

steps.title: Synthesis
steps.description: Combine best aspects of both approaches

sections.content: Specific patterns have proven effective for verification:

patterns.name: Implementation-Documentation Split
patterns.description: One model implements, another documents. Reveals understanding gaps.

patterns.name: Adversarial Review
patterns.description: One model reviews another's code critically. Uncovers hidden assumptions.

patterns.name: Parallel Development
patterns.description: Multiple models solve same problem independently. Shows solution space.

sections.title: Empirical Finding
sections.content: Multi-model verification reduces hallucination rate by approximately 60% in technical implementations. The remaining 40% requires domain expert validation.
